lesson1.front: polite equivalent of あのひと
ladies and gentlemen, all of you
Mr., Ms. (title of respect added to a name)
(suffix often added to a child's name instead of 〜さん)
(suffix often added to a boy's name)
(suffix meaning 'a national of'; e.g., アメリカじん, an American)
teacher, instructor (not used when referring to one's own job)
employee of ~ Company (used with a company's name; e.g., IMC のしゃいん)
polite equivalent of なんさい

lesson1.back: どうぞよろしく おねがいします

lesson2.front: that (thing far from the speaker, near the listener)
that (thing far from both the speaker and listener)
No, it isn't. You are wrong.
It's nothing./It's a token of my gratitude.
Please./Here you are. (used when offering someone something)

lesson2.back: これからあせわになります
lesson2.front: I hope for your kind assistance hereafter.
I am pleased to meet you. (response to どうぞよろしく)

lesson3.front: this way, this place (polite ここ)
that way, that place near you (polite そこ)
that way, that place over there (polite あそこ)

lesson3.back: かいぎしつ 会議室
トイレ(おてあらい) (お手洗い)
[~を] みせてください。 [~を] 見せてください。

lesson4.front: take a rest, take a holiday
rest, a holiday, a day off
That's tough, isn't it? (used when expressing sympathy)

lesson4.back: おといあわせのばんごう
[どうも]ありがとうごさいました

lesson5.front: which day of the month, how many days

cherry-blossom viewing (~をします: go cherry-blossom viewing)
a little while, a little bit

lesson7.front: Excuse me./Anybody home?/May I come in?
How nice of you to come. (lit. Welcome.)

lesson7.back: どうぞおあがりください

lesson7.front: Thank you./May I? (lit. I'm afraid I will be disturbing you.)
Won't you have [~]?/Would you like to have [~]?
Thank you./I accept. (said before starting to eat or drink.)

lesson8.front: cold (referring to touch, as a drink)
work, business (~おしごとをします: do one's job, work)

lesson8.back: にほんのせいかつになれましたか
lesson8.front: Have you got used to the life in Japan?

lesson8.back: [~、]もういっぱいいかがですか

lesson8.back: そろそろしつれいします
lesson8.front: It's almost time to leave now.

lesson8.back: またいらっしゃってください

lesson9.front: I'm sorry (to hear that)./That's a pity.

lesson9.back: いっしょにいかがですか

lesson9.front: [~] is a bit difficult. (an euphemism used when declining an invitation)

lesson9.back: またこんどおねがいします
lesson9.front: Please ask me again some other time. (when refusing an invitation indirectly, considering someone's feelings)

lesson10.front: a fixed place to catch taxis, trains, etc.
the most ~ (いちばん うえ: the top)
the ~th shelf (だん is the counter for shelves)

lesson11.back: やすみます[かいしゃを~]
エヤメール(こうくうびん)

lesson11.front: Welcome./May I help you? (a greeting to a customer or a guest entering a shop, etc.)
So long. (lit. Go and come back.)
So long. (lit. I'm going and coming back.)

lesson12.front: sushi (vinegar rice topped with raw fish)
tempura (seafood and vegetables deep fried in batter)
flower arrangement (~をします: practice flower arrangement)

lesson13.back: はいります[きっさてんに~]
さんぽします[こうえんを~]

lesson13.front: meeting, conference (~をします: hold a conference)

lesson13.back: おなかがいっぱいです。

lesson13.front: Let's do that. (used when agreeing to someone's suggestion)
bowl of rice topped with beef

lesson13.back: [しょうしょう]おまちください。

right (used when encouraging some course of action)

lesson15.back: すんでいます[おおさかに~]

[No,] I still have a long way to go.

lesson17.front: doctor (used when addressing a medical doctor)
a few ~ (~ is a counter suffix)
Take care of yourself. (said to people who are ill)

lesson18.back: それはおもしろいですね。

lesson19.front: pinball game (~をします: play pachinko)
Thank you. (used when expressing gratitude for help received.)
diet (~をします: go on a diet)

lesson20.front: I (an informal equivalent of わたし used by men)
you (an informal equivalent of あなた used by men)
Mr. (an informal equivalent of ~さん used by men)
yes (an informal equivalent of はい)
no (an informal equivalent of いいえ)
this way, this place (an informal equivalent of こちら)
this way, that place (an informal equivalent of そちら)
this way, that place over there (an informal equivalent of あちら)
which one (between two things), which way, where (an informal equivalent of どちら)
Are you going back to your country?

lesson21.front: speech (~を します: make a speech)
side job (~を します: work part time)
talk, speech, what one says, story (~を します: talk, tell a story)
There is no other choice. / It can't be helped.
It's been a long time (since I last saw you). / Long time no see.

lesson22.back: おめでとうございます。
lesson22.front: Congratulations. (used on birthdays, weddings, New Year's, etc.)

lesson23.back: きをつけます[くるまに~]

lesson23.front: That was delicious. (Said after eating or drinking)

lesson23.back: がいこくじんとうろくしょう

lesson25.front: transfer (~します: be transferred to another office)

lesson25.back: いっぱいのみましょう。
[いろいろ]おせわになりました。

Best of luck. (said when expecting a long separation)
